review: My occipital neuralgia started out of the blue like 5 weeks ago and getting more scans tomorrow to find the cause. Today is day 8 on 75mg Lyrica  (3 times daily) and honestly I haven't noticed any improvement. I have constant throbbing pain in back of head with shooting pain in the temple and forehead/eye socket. I can't sleep, I can't work. Just miserable. Does Lyrica need to be taken for a few weeks before any benefit? I keep hoping for relief and none has arrived yet.

It took a few weeks using Pregabalin 75mg tablets two a.m. and two p.m. but I now have significant relief from pain in back of head. If I’m a few hours late taking meds, It feels like someone knocked me in back of head with a board. I take Baclofen and Aleve, and get massages for the trigger points in occipital muscles, neck, and traps. Daily stretches from PT also help with range of motion. The pain had been severe for about nine months. Glad I was finally prescribed Pregabalin and gave it some time. Can barely feel the head soreness when I take it at consistent times.

Let's me function without being knocked out just to get some relief from the pain. Not a silver bullet but definitely has given me back so much functioning and quality of life.
